document.discussion_title: 20 years later, police may have answers in Trudy Appleby
document.topic_text: 20 years later, police may have answers in Trudy Appleby disapearance By Sarah Greene | Updated 08/21 2016 10:54PM EAST MOLINE, Ill. It's been two decades since 11-year-old, Trudy Appleby, went missing in Moline. Every year, Trudy's family holds a remembrance vigil in her honor. But this year, things were different. Detectives told the crowd they believe they know who is responsible for Trudy's disappearance. They just need people to speak up. The Moline Detective on the case, Michael Griffin said, "We would ask those people who know what happened to Trudy that day to come forward and tell us and let's end this nightmare for Trudy's family. " Police did say the person they think is responsible for Trudy's disappearance has died, but all they need to close the case are the people related to the suspect to tell a 20 year old family secret. If they can get that last piece of the puzzle, Trudy's loved ones can finally get the closure they've been looking for for 20 years. Trudy's Father, Dennis Appleby said, "I need that, I mean the whole community needs it. You just don't have an 11-year-old girl drop out of existence as this one appears to have done, and we know that that's not the case." Trudy's father said, he wants the question he's been asking for two decades answered. He asked, "Why did you do it? Why has it taken 20 years to say anything? Why, why is it that you think you feel it's right that you get to take and enjoy your life? You get to take and have the things that Trudy didn't, where's that fair?" While the hope of finding Trudy alive gets smaller as the years pass, the family still has hope their suffering will come to an end. "The only hope I have is that this gets corrected[..] the only hope I have is that this is done," said Dennis Appleby. Copyright 2016 Nexstar Broadcasting, Inc. All rights reserved.
